principles.name: Available
principles.definition: Data must exist and be accessible when needed, where needed.
principles.lean_connection: Just-In-Time inventory - data at point of decision without delay
principles.example: Real-time cell viability data for downstream process adjustments.

principles.name: Accessible
principles.definition: Users can retrieve data without unnecessary barriers.
principles.lean_connection: Removes motion waste - no unnecessary steps to find information
principles.example: QC analysts directly query historical batch data for trending.

principles.name: Consistent
principles.definition: Data follows standard definitions across organization.
principles.lean_connection: Standardized work - everyone follows same process.
principles.example: Viral vector titer measured consistently across all sites (vg/mL).

principles.name: Secure
principles.definition: Data protected from unauthorized access or modification.
principles.example: Patient trial data encrypted with audit logs tracking access.

principles.name: Reusable
principles.definition: Data collected once serves multiple purposes without rework.
principles.lean_connection: Eliminates overproduction waste - capture once, use many times.
principles.example: Process parameters feed real-time control, batch records, trending, regulatory reports.

principles.name: Interoperable
principles.definition: Systems exchange information across platforms and contexts.
principles.lean_connection: Value stream mapping - data flows smoothly without handoff delays
principles.example: MES automatically sends data to QMS triggering inspection workflows.

principles.name: Scalable
principles.definition: Infrastructure handles growth in volume without redesign.
principles.lean_connection: Flexible manufacturing - adapts to demand changes.
principles.example: Architecture scales from 10 to 100 batches/month seamlessly.

principles.name: Governed
principles.definition: Clear ownership, accountability, and rules for data.
principles.lean_connection: Leader standard work - clear ownership and accountability.
principles.example: RACI matrix: Manufacturing owns generation, Quality owns acceptance criteria.
